title: ‘Every single cage is full’: Nearly 100 cats rescued from Rhode Island hoarding situation
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: RISPCA rescued 97 cats from a hoarding situation in a 1200-square-foot apartment in Woonsocket, Rhode Island.
The cats, some pregnant, primarily appear healthy, though some suffer from colds due to the hoarding conditions.
RISPCA is seeking donations for supplies and medical expenses for the rescued cats through Venmo or PayPal.

title: What Jarren Duran said of trade rumors, reps at DH with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jarren Duran, 29, may shift to DH due to a crowded Red Sox outfield including Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela.
Duran, with 4.7 WAR and 16 home runs in 2025, addressed trade rumors, stating he doesn't focus on them.
He attributes his readiness for role changes to teammate Rob Refsnyder and is open to team needs at DH.

title: Bruins’ Jordan Harris looking to make hockey more accessible, inclusive in Mass.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordan Harris is promoting hockey accessibility through a clinic hosted with SCORE Boston at Warrior Ice Arena.
Harris' Huskies program partners with SCORE Boston to provide equipment and ice time to underserved youth.
The initiative aims to break barriers in hockey, with support from the NHL, the Boston Bruins Foundation, and Rapid7.

title: When will Jayson Tatum return for Celtics? Bill Simmons makes his prediction.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from an Achilles injury, likely around March 1, according to Bill Simmons.
Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 practice with the Maine Celtics, indicating progress in his rehabilitation.
NBC hinted at Tatum's return with a trailer for a docuseries, coinciding with the Celtics vs. 76ers game schedule change.

title: State Police trooper seriously injured after cruiser hit on North Shore highway
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A Massachusetts State Police trooper was seriously injured in a car crash on I-95 South in Salisbury.
Driver Josue Levi Cuevas Santana is charged with negligent operation, speeding, and failing to move over for an emergency vehicle.
The injured trooper has been discharged from Portsmouth Regional Hospital and is recovering at home, State Police reported.

title: Fleet goalie Aerin Frankel sets Olympic record, helps Team USA advance to gold-medal game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Aerin Frankel posted three shutouts during the 2026 Winter Olympics, setting an Olympic women's hockey record.
Frankel's performance helped Team USA beat Sweden 5-0, advancing to the gold-medal game against Canada.
Team USA has a total shutout streak of 331 minutes, surpassing the previous Olympic record by over 86 minutes.

title: Woman found dead, search for husband suspended after couple falls through ice in Eastham, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A woman died after falling through ice at First Encounter Beach in Eastham on Feb. 14, officials confirm.
Her husband remains missing despite extensive search efforts involving drones and dive teams, paused due to ice conditions.
The couple's dog was found distressed and wet; police and fire divisions are leading ongoing search efforts for the man.

title: ‘Just pick up a glove’: Tom Werner was disappointed in Rafael Devers saga
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded to the San Francisco Giants by the Red Sox in June 2025 after internal conflicts.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner expressed disappointment at Devers' reluctance to play first base during team injuries.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy admitted the franchise could have managed the transition and Devers' role differently.

title: What Sam Kennedy said about Bregman, Devers, and ‘hurtful’ narrative about Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox President Sam Kennedy refutes claims that ownership lacks passion for winning, emphasizing the team's commitment to success.
Rafael Devers was traded after conflicts over his position following the signing of Alex Bregman, who later joined the Cubs.
The Red Sox's projected $256.1 million luxury tax payroll for 2026 is the seventh-highest in MLB, reflecting ownership's investment.

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Three people, including the shooter, died in a shooting at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket, Rhode Island; three others were injured.
The shooting, deemed a 'targeted family dispute' by authorities, occurred during a high school hockey game around 2:30 p.m.
Police identified the shooter as Robert Dorgan, confirming a self-inflicted gunshot wound; investigation into victims' identities continues.
